fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users without an Atlassian account log in through SSO, they are prompted the following message:
{quote}Whoops! The address you entered doesn't seem to be a valid email address. Try checking your email address with your organization admin.
{quote}
Instead of being prompted to create the new Atlassian account.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in using SSO to Atlassian with an email address that does not have an Atlassian account.

h3. Expected Results
The user is prompted to create the Atlassian account with the information sent by the Identity Provider.

h3. Actual Results
The user receives an error saying the email address is not valid.

h3. Workaround
Ask the end user to [Signup for an account|https://id.atlassian.com/signup] manually.
fields.summary: Just-In-Time provisioning for SAML is not working to create new Atlassian accounts

fields.description:
When purchasing a new Atlassian product, it will be added to its own organization, instead of one of the currently existing organizations that the administrator has. This means that the user will need to go through the [process to transfer the product into the existing organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/transfer-products-to-another-organization-967318518.html] and dedicate some time in order to have it done.

This is a suggestion to allow the administrator to select which organization the newly purchased site should go instead of creating a new one/having it associated with its own organization.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to select which organization a new site will be added

fields.description:
*Use Case* 

- Invited a new domain account to Jira, Confluence and Bitbucket cloud, granting license. 
- User did not action the invite and the account remain unused and unverified. 
- On a clean up activity, the unverified account is not available in Managed Accounts and cannot be deactivated to free up licenses.  (see ACCESS-617)
- Product admins would need to revoke access individually on the cloud products to revoke license. 

*Suggestion* :

Allow org admins to deactivate unused / unverified accounts or have an alternative option in Managed accounts to revoke license for all products at once. 

*Workaround* :

Use User Provisioning to automatically provision active accounts. Deactivation can then be managed from the IDP for freeing up licenses taken by the Atlassian Account.
fields.summary: Allow account deactivation for unverified accounts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I would like to be able to enable 2FA in multiple devices.
fields.summary: Allow 2FA to be enable in multiple devices

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
As per [Session duration management \- Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/session-duration-management-976763148.html], Account on Mobile apps will not be affected. 

It would be good to include the mobile app platform's idle Session Duration to be managed by the Organization admin.
fields.summary: Allow Session Duration for Mobile apps to be managed by Organization admins

fields.description:
At the moment, it is not possible to manage access into Trello from a third party identity service provider via Atlassian Access. 

Suggestion : Implement user and group provisioning via Atlassian Access with Trello
fields.summary: Implement user and group provisioning with Trello

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Ability to sync group description from the identity provider

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce the option to sync group description from the identity provider

h3. Why this is important
Customers should be able to sync group description from the identity provider
fields.summary: Ability to sync group description from the identity provider

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After a user is deactivated from the Admin Hub, his Atlassian account is set to inactive and his Bitbucket account becomes inactive. However in Admin Hub (admin.atlassian.com) the user is still showing as if he has Bitbucket Cloud access.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Atlassian account within a managed domain.
 # Create a Bitbucket account on this AA.
 # Deactivate this account from Admin hub

h3. Expected Results
Deactivated user shouldn't show any product access anymore after he is deactivated.

h3. Actual Results
Deactivated user show up still having Bitbucket access.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deactivated user on Admin hub still shows as having Product access

fields.description:
In the [documentation covering the enforced two-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html], it suggests the user with outdated instructions to check accounts without two-step verification enabled:
{quote}
h2. See accounts without two-step verification enabled

You can see a list of all accounts from your verified domains that don't yet have two-step verification enabled:
 #  From your organization at [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/], select *Directory* and then *Managed accounts*.
 # Click *Show users without two-step verification*.

This displays all the Atlassian accounts that are managed in your organization that don't have two-step verification enabled. You can use it to see which people will be affected if you enforce two-step verification, as well as to see those who are yet to enable two-step verification after you've enforced it.
{quote}
Currently, in order to see those accounts, the user must tap the *All Accounts* dropdown in the *Managed accounts* part and then, select the *Not enabled* option under *Two-step verification*:

This is a suggestion to update the instructions to reflect how the feature works, like the following:
 # From your organization at [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/], select *Directory* and then *Managed accounts*.
 # Tap *All accounts* to display a dropdown.
# Select *Not enabled*, under the *Two-step verification* menu.
fields.summary: Documentation update: Enforced Two-step verification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The dropdown option two-step verification "Not enabled" is not working
 !Screenshot 2020-02-05 at 13.40.08.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an organization where two-step verification is enforced
 # Filter the users who do not have two-step verification enabled
# Users with two-step verification enabled will also show up in the list

h3. Expected Results
Users with two-step verification enabled should not be displayed in the list

h3. Actual Results
Users with two-step verification enabled are being displayed in the list

h3. Workaround
The Export account feature shows the list of users with Yes/No against 2FA field.
fields.summary: The dropdown option two-step verification "Not enabled" is not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the [Org audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/audit-logging-970612562.html] only store when users under the managed account logs in or logs out. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Thinking in a wider control over the Atlassian product, it would be great to have that same information for unmanaged accounts that have access to the site/products linked to the Org.
fields.summary: Include unmanaged accounts log in attempts in the Org Audit logs

fields.description: When self-sign up is enabled for a specific set of domains, admins always get notifications for users signing up. This may be undesirable. I would like to suggest that the option be enabled for this mode.
fields.summary: Allow Disable Admin notifications for Self Sign up for approved domains

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a [managed Atlassian Account is set to deletion|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/delete-a-managed-account-961259516.html] all the Org Administrators are notified. This might be disruptive to some teams/companies. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a feature that allows [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] administrators to select who will receive that kind of notification.
fields.summary: Make it possible to select the Org admins that will be notified when a managed account is set to deletion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Ability to rename groups after they've synced to the organization from an identity provider.

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer wants to rename groups after they've synced to the organization from an identity provider.

h3. Why this is important
The customer wants the renamed groups to appear in the organization from an identity provider.
fields.summary: Ability to rename groups after they've synced to the organization from an identity provider.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Ability to see who which users do not have 2FA enabled in an organization

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer wants to see who which users do not have 2FA enabled in an organization

h3. Why this is important
The customer wants to audit and inform users to enable 2FA if excluded in an organization
fields.summary: Ability to see who which users do not have 2FA enabled in an organization

fields.description:
With the user provisioning features, identity providers such as Azure support syncing of large number of users and groups. This is prone to creating a bulk number of Atlassian Accounts that are not meant to be provisioned. 

At the moment, the org administration does not provide any clean up option for removing incorrectly provisioned users and groups. Admins will need to trigger a delete on users one by one to clean up. 

*Suggestion* :

Provide a bulk clean up method  for provisioned users and groups. For deletion of accounts, also allow to bypass notifications to end users.
fields.summary: Bulk delete option for user provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Groups* tab under the *User provisioning* screen for Access is timing out to load the group list.

 !image-2020-01-04-16-49-08-405.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Having a large number of provisioned groups (Around 1.000)
 # Go to the *Groups* tab

h3. Expected Results
A list of 20 groups will be shown.

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed instead of the groups list.
{noformat}No information found, try again later.{noformat}

h3. Workaround
The issue is intermitent, so reloading the page might load the groups list.

h3. Notes
The timeout might occur when switching the groups pages, too.
fields.summary: The Groups tab under User provisioning is timing out

fields.description:
When using Just-in-Time provisioning as described in our documentation here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html#SAMLsinglesign-on-Just-in-timeprovisioningwithSAML

The provisioning does not have the ability to control group enrollment based on input from the IdP (such as attributes). This means that a SCIM module must be developed in order to use custom SAML solutions e.g. Shibboleth or on premises ADFS.

Because of the complexity that this can introduce, I would like to offer the suggestion that adding the ability to control group enrollment by SAML attributes be considered.
fields.summary: Allow Group enrollment based on SAML attributes when using Just-In-Time provisioning

fields.description: Jumpcloud is an identity provider that can be integrated with Atlassian Access via SAML. It would be a good feature to allow Jumpcloud to be integrated with the user provisioning feature as well.
fields.summary: Support user provisioning with Jumpcloud

fields.description:
At the moment, the org admin panel is not able to give an error message if a verification email has been blocked. 

Steps to replicate :
 * Edit any managed account
 * Change the email address to a non-domain email address. 

If the non-domain email address is invalid (not fully created) yet, the email will bounce back to Atlassian and the email address will be blocked. Any further attempts to try to change the email address will not work as the address has already been blocked. Admins will need to reach to Atlassian support to check the email address. 

Suggestion :

Provide a better messaging for cases when the target email address has been blocked.
fields.summary: Better messaging for blocked verification email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Organization Administrators would like a way to sync Managed Account Profile Photos from their IdP into the User's Atlassian account

h3. Suggested Solution
Support *Photos* as a synced SCIM Attribute with Atlassian Access User Provisioning

h3. Why this is important
A User's Profile Photo/Avatar may be maintained at the Identity Provider level and should be synced across all Sites that integrate with their IdP
 
h3. Workaround 
Users can upload a Profile Photo by going to id.atlassian.com/manage-profile 
or 
Organization Administrators can set the Profile Photo of their Managed Accounts within the Admin Hub (admin.atlassian.com)
fields.summary: Support Syncing User's Profile Photo with SCIM User Provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing a domain account's email address to a non-domain address twice results to something went wrong. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit any domain account and change the email address to a non-domain address. 
 # Do not verify the target email address. 
 # Edit the same domain account and change the email address again to a non-domain address. 

h3. Expected Results

The change should be allowed or the 24 hour limit message should be specified. 

 !limit.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Something went wrong message is returned. 

 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Wait for 24 hours to try the change again.
fields.summary: Limit on email address change to a non-domain account

fields.description: Allow Statuspage to be covered by the features provided by Atlassian Access.
fields.summary: Statuspage with Atlassian Access

fields.description: Allow Opsgenie to be covered in the features provided by Atlassian Access.
fields.summary: Opsgenie with Atlassian Access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 
When you sync a lot of groups synced is really painful to go through each page to find a specific group.

 !Screen Shot 2019-12-06 at 19.53.56.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important

Having an option to search for the groups would make things a lot easier to find how many users are synced in a specific group.

h3. Note

This would have an impact especially for large enterprise companies with multiple departments and groups.

h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Provide a search dialog box for the provisioning directory panel under organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Now if an Org Admin left the organization, there is no possible way for the existing Site-Admins to remove him, they have to contact support to either remove the ORg admin or to get the link to remove the Org Admin from the Admin Panel.

h3. Proposed Solution

Provide a way to remove Org-Admins with much less effort or allow Site-Admins to remove him from the Site-Admin Group.
fields.summary: Ability to remove Org Admins in a more straightaway process.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deactivating a managed account and then enabling G Suite on that account domain will cause the account to be locked at the deactivated status. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or access an Organization.
# [Verify|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html] your domain over.
# Deactivate one or more user.
# Remove the domain from your Organization.
# Integrate G Suite with the domain used previously.

h3. Expected Results

Although the user Atlassian Account is deactivated the Org admin should be able to re-activate him.

h3. Actual Results

The user Atlassian Account cannot be re-activated by the Org admins and thus the user will be locked out.

h3. Notes

The affected users' information should still be synced through G Suite so the sync itself is not broken just the status of the user in Atlassian's side.
Keep in mind that the verification process for the domain will trigger an email message to the users behind this domain.

h3. Workaround

If you have many users under this state please do the following:
# Remove the G Suite integration.
# [Verify|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html] your domain at an Organization.
# Re-activate the impacted users.
# Remove the domain verified and re-activate G Suite.

If assistance is needed along the way please engage support.
fields.summary: Deactivated Atlassian Accounts can't be re-activated when G Suite is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Organization admins can only see the overall details of users being synced on their groups via SCIM.

This is not that good when a mismatch problem happens as the admins have no easy way to compare which users are being synced on their pushed groups and which are only present on their IdP.

h3. Suggested Solution

The detailed information is already available for admins through the [SCIM endpoints|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/#api-scim-directory-directoryId-Groups-get] but it would be more user-friendly to have this group membership details displayed in the UI or available via an export.

h3. Why this is important
 
Having this implemented admins would be able to spot problems with specific users not being synced from their IdP to Atlassian's side more easily.

This would also be helpful for admins to spot issues within the sync from their SCIM directory to their instances.

h3. Workaround 

Use the [Get groups|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/#api-scim-directory-directoryId-Groups-get] endpoint from the SCIM API.
(i) This requires the admins to know their directory API token.
fields.summary: Add group membership details for groups being synced via SCIM

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * When a domain is verified, all Atlassian accounts using that verified domain become "managed accounts"
 * Those managed accounts appear in the organization under Directory > Managed accounts
 * However, if an Atlassian account won't appear under "Managed accounts", it's likely that the account is not verified - i.e. the end-user hasn't either:
 ** Clicked the link to verify the account
 ** Reset the password and logged into the Atlassian account
 * Please note all new Atlassian accounts need to be verified as per [Create an Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/create-an-atlassian-account-976161170.html]. This is different from domain verification.
 * This behaivor is described in ACCESS-36

h3. Suggested Solution
 * The [Managed accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html] documentation should be updated to inform the reader that accounts that are unverified won't appear in the "Managed accounts" list - link the reader to information regarding how the Atlassian account verification process works.

h3. Why this is important
 * Customers are reporting "missing users", but in reality - the user accounts exist, it's just that those accounts have yet to be verified and thus won't appear in the "Managed accounts" list
 * ACCESS-36 won't be implemented
 * May cause confusion for org. admins who are trying to change the email address of an Atlassian account to an email address that is already taken by another account.  The other account with the desired email address isn't visible and therefore must not exist
 * There isn't a way for org. admins to list/search for unverified Atlassian accounts on their domain(s) -  ACCESS-137

h3. Workaround
 * Make sure that end-users have clicked the link in the Atlassian account verification email as described in this document: [Create an Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/create-an-atlassian-account-976161170.html]:
{quote}We'll email you asking that you verify your email address. That's it!

If you don't see the verification email, check your spam folder for an email from noreply@mailer.atlassian.com or noreply@mail.notifications.atlassian.com. If you still don't see the verification email, return to the log in screen to resend the email.
{quote}
 * Ask the end-user to reset their password via [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword]
 * As long as the end-user is able to log in - then the account is "verified"
fields.summary: Documentation update: Managed accounts page

fields.description:
h3. Disclaimer
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
(!) This difficulty was already described in another Bug report ([ACCESS-766|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-766]) therefore, to avoid confusion, this one will be closed. Please keep tracking this issue on [ACCESS-766|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-766].

Apologies for the inconvenience.
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
The *Based in* field is gets locked out on Managed accounts of a [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] when the SCIM integration is enabled. 
!image.png|thumbnail!
However, the SCIM does not support that field yet (there is no matching *Target attribute*) therefore, the admins can edit that through the IdP sync neither at the Org side.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate with SCIM
# Try to update that field at Org > Directory > Managed accounts > User profile or at the IdP.

h3. Expected Results
The field would get updated through the SCIM integration. 

h3. Actual Results
# The SCIM does not support the field.
# The admins can't change that manually due to the integration.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to edit "Based in" field when SCIM is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Atlassian is delivering a new experience to the Atlassian Access hub that allows admins to verify the domain and check what will be the claimed accounts before finishing the process. With this new method, we can consider that there is two status for the domain claim process:
# *domain verified:* when the token was correctly added to the DNS/HTTPS side and Atlassian acknowledged that.
# *claimed accounts:* when the Org admin chooses to claim the accounts related to that domain. 

However, when the Org admins choose not to claim the accounts, but the domain is already verified, the message in the SAML SSO setting page says that the user needs to verify a domain:
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solutions
* In this scenario, it would be more efficient to notify the users that there must be claimed accounts to be able to proceed with the SAML SSO setup since the domain is "already verified".
* Add an intermediate status lozenge that says something like "Accounts claim required" or similar.
fields.summary: Improve the messages in the new domain verification experience

fields.description:
Document: [Verify a domain for your organization 873871234.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html]

Under "Domain verification considerations" and in the context of the HTTPs verification method, it would be beneficial to:
* Include the user agent information of the client that we use to verify domains on the verification page.
* Include information as to how to troubleshoot issues with HTTPs domain verification - checking the "atlassian-domain-verification.html" via a browser, etc.

The reason being is that more and more customers are deploying Web Application Firewalls(WAF) and we may need to be whitelisted.  This information would be useful in helping customers identify issues with domain verification, esp. when "atlassian-domain-verification.html" is accessible, but the domain still can't be verified.
fields.summary: Documentation update: Domain Verification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When connecting Atlassian Access to a third party identity service provider, the *Based In* (location) attribute of an Atlassian Account cannot be updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Atlassian Access setup user provisioning
 # Try to map a location attribute from the third party IDP into the location attribute in Atlassian.

h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to map the location attribute into the Atlassian Account

h3. Actual Results

The location attribute of a user cannot be mapped. 

 !location.png|thumbnail! 


On the managed account profile, the location attribute is blocked due to user provisioning

h3. Workaround

The provisioned users can still fill in the details on Atlassian side. 
- As the end user, login to Atlassian and access https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility
- Edit the *Based In* information.

 !based in.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Based in (location) cannot be updated via user provisioning

fields.description:
It would be good to have the ability to exclude accounts from the domain claim process for cases where global companies want to have their domain claimed, but have different management process for teams around the globe. 

There are cases where completely separate paying cloud instances are used from completely separated teams from the same company. Claiming the company's domain impact all users, even if the said team has no knowledge or control over the other team.
fields.summary: It would be good to have the ability to exclude accounts from the domain claim

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * It's easy to get confused between the UIs for Jira/Confluence user management and organization management(Atlassian Access)
 * Both UIs look the same and they're both hosted on admin.atlassian.com
 * Although there is overlap - both UIs serve different functions

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Use a unique hostname/subdomain for those services
 * Make a clearer distinction between org. management and product-level management.

h3. Why this is important
 * A not uncommon question that customers are raising is "I'm on the page -admin.atlassian.com, but I can't see any Access billing details or features.   Where can I configure SAML?"

h3. Workaround
 * Use this as a guide:
||What am I looking for?||How do I get there?||Example URL of page||
|Jira/Confluence user management|Cloud instance > User Management|https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<cloud_id>/users|
|Organization management|[admin.atlassian.com|https://admin.atlassian.com/] directly|https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<org_id>/overview|
fields.summary: Jira/Confluence user management page and Org. management(Atlassian Access) pages should be more differentiated
"Keep me logged in" is no longer an option in Cloud

fields.description:
Most identity providers support the ability to encrypt the assertions sent from an identity provider to a service provider like Atlassian.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/howto-saml-token-encryption

Atlassian would provide a public key certificate that can be uploaded to the identity provider to encrypt the assertions.
fields.summary: Support encrypted SAML assertions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

There are 2 events when user added to the site, that are not yet available in Organization Audit logs (Atlassian Access):
#  Self sign up: When a user perform self sign up where the email address is one of the allowed domain.
#  Site admin approve access request: Users can request product access for themselves or others when the site access settings don’t allow them to join the site

h3. Suggested Resolution

Add the above 2 events.
fields.summary: Add Self sign-up and Site admin approve access request events in Audit log

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an Organization Admin in Atlassian Cloud(Jira/Confluence), I have the ability to disable user's access to a specific Jira/Confluence product but this doesn't include *Bitbucket* Product.

Hence, this limits the admin's ability to manage their uses' product access and their Atlassian Access subscription if the managed user creates a Bitbucket Account.

*Sample image:*
!image-2019-10-17-12-15-32-318.png|thumbnail! 
 (i) URL: [https://admin.atlassian.com/s/]<organization-uuid>/users/<user-account0uuid>
h3. Suggested Solution

Include Bitbucket Cloud product in the access management page to allow admin to manage users' access to a Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Ability for an org admin to manage users' access to Bitbucket product

fields.description: The domain verification claim token generated by admin.atlassian.com can contain the '+' character. Some DNS services do not support setting such strings in the TXT record of DNS (e.g.: F5). It would be good if the tokens generated do not have such special characters.
fields.summary: Support domain claim verification tokens that do not have the '+' character

fields.description:
The [User provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] documentation states:
{quote}
Provisioning for user accounts is available for Jira products, Confluence, and Bitbucket. Group syncing is currently only available for Jira products and Confluence and not yet available for Bitbucket.
{quote}

There is some ambiguity as to what "user accounts" refers to.  It's not clear whether "user accounts" refers to Atlassian accounts or Jira, Confluence or Bitbucket user accounts.  

In the case of  Bitbucket, yes you can provision the Atlassian account, but a Bitbucket account still needs to be manually created.  Whereas in a Jira/Confluence context, an org. admin may choose to allow "New users have access to this product" in Product access and add users directly to the IDP "Atlassian Cloud" app.  The Atlassian accounts are provisioned, a Jira/Confluence account is created and a license is allocated to that newly created user - group sync. is not configured.  The quote from the documentation apepars to hint that the Bitbucket experience is currently the same as that of Jira/Confluence in relation to provisioning and product access.

Perhaps a clearer distinction between Atlassian accounts, product access and product specific accounts would help clarify what provisioning can/can't do.
fields.summary: Documentation update: User provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Searching for managed users from within the Organization is not working as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Verify a domain
 # Add users with managed accounts
 # Access the managed accounts page and search using a word with at least 3 letters

h3. Expected Results
The search returns the exact user from the word you added to the search.

h3. Actual Results
It returns any user that has at least part of 3 letters from the searched word. For example, if you search using the word "Charlie", it will return not only the "Charlie", but any other users with the name or email with parts of the word, such as "Chapman", "Charlotte", "Chance", etc.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search from within Organization Doesn't Work Properly

fields.description:
At the moment, the user provisioning solution with Atlassian Access does not support renaming of provisioned groups. 

Suggestion :
Allow group rename from IDP to propagate into Atlassian. 

Workaround :
- Create a new group in IDP to indicate the new group name.
- Configure the group membership
- Provision the new group into Atlassian.
fields.summary: Support group renaming for provisioned group

fields.description:
h3. *Current functionality:*

SAML SSO uses *givenname* and *surname* attributes to define the *Full name* for an Atlassian account.

User provisioning ( SCIM ) uses *displayName* attribute to define the *Full name* for an Atlassian account.

That said, it's possible to have different values mapped by SCIM and by SAML and with this SCIM will update when syncing and SAML will update when users log in.

h3. *The suggestion:*

Knowing that some IdPs don't support changing the *givenname* and *surname* it would be great if, when having SCIM, only the attribute send by SCIM is considered. Otherwise, customers may face unwanted *Full name* changes for their users due to both integrations values mismatch.

h3. *Workaround:*

The workaround we suggest is to remove the *givenname* and *surname* attributes of SAML from being sent by the IdP, with this the SCIM attribute will be the only one updating the value.

Note: this is only applicable for IdPs which allow modifying/removing the attributes.
fields.summary: Prioritize SCIM Full Name attribute over SAML when both integrations are being used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After configuring provisioning as per the instructions here: [Atlassian Cloud provisioning tutorial|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-provisioning-tutorial], the initial sync. works, but after a period of time the sync fails with this message on the Azure AD portal:
{quote}Quarantined due to a high number of errors. Please view the audit logs below to assess the errors and remediate them. Sync interval reduced to once per 24 hours.​
{quote}
h3. Environment
 * Azure Ad
 * Provisioning via SCIM

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure provisioning with Azure AD as per the instructions here: [Atlassian Cloud provisioning tutorial|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-provisioning-tutorial]
 # Select/check the "Clear current state and restart synchronization"
 # Save the configuration
 # The sync. process will start/complete
 # Wait a while - testing has shown that sometime between 20mins and 2hrs the sync. will fail the message mentioned in the Issue Summary

h3. Expected Results
 * Sync. will continue to run

h3. Actual Results
 * This message is shown in the Provisioning configuration page on Azure AD:
{quote}Quarantined due to a high number of errors. Please view the audit logs below to assess the errors and remediate them. Sync interval reduced to once per 24 hours.​
{quote}
 * 401 responses from the Atlassian global proxy
 * In most cases, clicking "Test Connection" in Azure AD will return an error:
!image-2019-10-04-12-35-56-676.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * You may need to switch between the two "Scope" options on the Azure AD configuration page i.e. toggle between "Sync all users and groups" and "Sync only assigned users and groups"
 * Checking "Clear current state and restart synchronization" may be necessary to reproduce the issue

h3. Workaround
 * Regenerate/rotate the API key(reference: [User provisioning|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/]):
{quote} # Go to admin.atlassian.com and click your organization.
 # Click Directory, then click User provisioning.
 # Click the Directory tab, then click the Regenerate API key button.
 # Click Regenerate key.
 # Copy the organization ID and the API key to a safe place. Once you close the API key information screen, we won't show you this information again.
 # Click Done.{quote}
 * Enter the new key into the "Secret Token" field on the Azure AD provisioning configuration page
 * Click "Test Connection" - the test should pass
 * Save the configuration
 * The sync. should restart
fields.summary: Provisioning: Azure AD - Sync. process is quarantined after a period of time

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have ended support for IE11 on *31 March 2020*.

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.
{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 7 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

My name is Rak Garg, and I am a product manager at Atlassian. I have good news! We’ve been hard at work on an all-new [Organization audit log|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access/guide/elements/organization-audit-log], which brings a complete log of all of your company-owned managed accounts login activity. This includes password resets and log in attempts. The log retains these activities for 6 months, but can be exported to CSV or via our organizations API. You must have an Atlassian Access subscription to view these activities. 

If you have any questions or suggestions for future reporting functionality, please don’t hesitate to email me at rgarg@atlassian.com or comment on this ticket.

Best,
Rak Garg
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is only possible to obtain a user's last login date and time. There's not a way to review the users' access logs for the last {{x Days}}, {{x Weeks}}, {{x Months}}, etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an Audit Log similar to the one JIRA has for User Management. This would include data such as password changes, login information, etc.
fields.summary: As an admin, provide a way to create a report of a user's login data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Access audit logs retention is set to 6 months so logs older than 6 months will get automatically deleted and there are no options to automatically export these logs before their deletion.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement other export options where admins could choose a timestamp for the logs to be exported automatically and possibly provide the option for the admins to provide a server where the logs would be exported too.

h3. Why this is important

As the log retention for the Access audit logs is 6 months admins may forget to export the logs during that time and lose access to this information.
 
h3. Workaround 

* Set reminders to manually export the logs before they expire.
* Create a script to automatically export the logs through the Organization audit logs [API endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/#api-orgs-orgId-events-get] from time to time.
fields.summary: Export logs configurations for Access audit logs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an Org admin is [verifying a domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html] there it has no visibility over who are the users that will be notified in that process.

h3. Suggested Solutions
After Atlassian identify the token in the verified domain(s) HTML file/DNS record, there is a step before finishing the verification process, that allows the Org admins to see all the Atlassian Accounts that will receive the notification before triggering it.
fields.summary: Display to Org admins the accounts that will receive the domain claim notification

h3. Issue Summary

For organizations without an AA subscription, org admins are unable to disable 2FA for users.

 # Claim a domain under an organization. 
 # Do not start the Atlassian Access free trial.
 # As the end user, enable 2FA via https://id.atlassian.com
 # As the org admin, go to managed accounts and try to disable the 2FA for the end user.

The org admin should be able to disable 2FA for the end user.

Clicking on _Exclude from two-step verification_ does not do anything and 2FA cannot be disabled.

Enable the Free Trial for the Atlassian Access and try to exclude again.

Suggestion :
Provide the ability for site owners to enforce security features on their external users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating a managed account that has been linked through SSO to an unmanaged domain any new accounts created for that old managed email won't be able to use SSO.

As the SAML integration will look for the user UPN or other unique immutable identifier sent from the IdP it will still find that SAML link attached to the now unmanaged account and thus the login will fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update a managed account that has already logged in through SAML to an unmanaged domain. E.g a@managed.com > a@unmanaged.com
# Create a new account with the managed email that was in use(a@managed.com) or update an existing account to that address.
# Trigger a new login with SSO to that account.

h3. Expected Results

When the Org admin updates the original account email to an unmanaged email the SAML link should be cleared and the login should work.

h3. Actual Results

The link remains associated with the now unmanaged account and the user will receive the following error when trying to log in:
{noformat:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
https://id.atlassian.com/login/callback?error=access_denied&error_description=verify-saml-domains:invalid-email-domain-for-primary-user&state=xxxxxx3f0818497a384f24cb5c1d44440bc81at
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

It's possible to work around this bug in three manners:
* Change the email of the original(now unmanaged) account back to one of your verified domains. This will make the account managed again and a new login to the new account should re-do the linking into the new account holding a@managed.com automatically.
(i) _This is the preferable approach as it should cause less disruption to the Org users_
* Verify the unmanaged domain that the account was updated to. Similar to the first approach this will make the account holding the link managed and our system will be able to re-do the linking on a new login. Note that by verifying the new domain all users from this domain will start using your SSO configuration and will be notified.
* Re-do the SAML integration. This will make all new logins create a new SAML link, thus the affected users will have a new link created to their correct account and will be able to log in.

If none of those approaches are feasible for your use case please contact [support|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Users can't login using SSO after having their previous account updated to an unmanaged domain.

fields.description:
h3. Description
Org admins sometimes need to know which users in their organization have generated (or used) a API Tokens. It would be nice to have this information available to organization admins when requested.

Also, it would be nice to have the API Token use as a filtering criteria in the list of users, just as it is possible to filter by domain and product access.

h3. Suggested solution
There exists a feature under *Directory > Manage Accounts* that allows organization admins to export information related to the managed accounts. A possible solution for this request would be to add separate column in the CSV export of users containing the date when a user's API token was last used.
fields.summary: provide user filtering by the use of API Token

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * When transferring a site, it's not made clear in the process/wizard that the act of transferring a site may add additional "site-admins" to a site which may(depending on [product access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-product-access-settings-744721629.html] settings) allocate that user(s) a license.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * When ACCESS-723 is resolved, add the same snippet of text in product so that users are fully aware that there may be cost involved when transferring a site between organizations.

h3. Why this is important
 * Customers may be unaware that the change/process of transferring sites to an organization may affect their billing and license counts

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds
fields.summary: Possibility of unintended license when transferring products to another organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently we have an option to [transfer products to another Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/transfer-products-to-another-organization-967318518.html], however, that will move all the existent instances/cloud sites from one Org to another. It will be great to have the option to choose which site(s) to move to another Org.  

h3. Suggested Solutions
Make it possible to choose what Cloud site the admins want to move in this transfer process.
fields.summary: Make it possible for Org Administrators to select the sites to transfer from one Org to another

fields.description:
h3. *Suggestion:*

It would be nice to have the ability to restrict users under a verified domain to not create Atlassian Accounts or to have to pass through an approval flow.

h3. *Business case:*

For large companies, some users end up creating empty managed Atlassian Accounts that will start to populate the managed accounts count and to delete these account it's required to wait for 14-days grace.
fields.summary: Restrict Atlassian Account creation at the Organization

fields.description:
[Transfer products to another organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/transfer-products-to-another-organization-967318518.html#Transferproductstoanotherorganization-Transferprocess] documentation states:
{quote}Organization admins of the original organization become admins of the destination organization.
 All organization admins become site admins of all sites associated with the organization.
{quote}
There is no mention of [product access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-product-access-settings-744721629.html] settings affecting license allocation in the context of org. admins being added to instances/sites. We should add a section to warn customers that depending on the product access settings, newly added users(site-admins in this case) may be unintentionally assigned a product license - incurring extra costs.
fields.summary: Documentation update: Transfer products to another organization

fields.description:
The strength of the password reported by the password change page before submitting does not show the conclusion that will be reported by the Validator.

During registration, I type password which is rated as "fair". But when I try to proceed, it turns out no be not enough fair - it does not meet some requirements.
I think it should be corrected to be consistent.

- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-105
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-91

h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround is to change the password multiple times until it is acceptable.
fields.summary: password change page reports strength of password as stronger than the validator does

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the process of finding and deactivating inactive users(haven't accessed any products for a long time) is strictly manual as admins can either use:
# The *Export accounts* feature inside the *Managed Accounts*
# The Organization [get users REST endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/#api-orgs-orgId-users-get]

To find those users by looking at the *Last active* date.

So, the deactivation of the accounts still depends on manually checking how long your users have been inactive and then manually deactivating them or developing a script to use the [user management REST deactivation endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/#api-users-account-id-manage-lifecycle-disable-post].

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a deactivation policies feature for Atlassian Access where admins can configure default time for users to be deactivated by being inactive.

Admins would then be able to configure that users who haven't accessed any products in the last 3 months will get automatically deactivated.

Additionally, the feature could trigger an email message to the deactivated users saying why they were deactivated and who they need to contact.

h3. Why this is important

For organizations with thousands of users, the current methods of finding and deactivating, inactive users requires a lot of work from the organization admins and as the company grows this tends to get more difficult to be done.
fields.summary: Deactivation policies for managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Atlassian Access subscription is needed to enforce two step-verification. However, enforced 2FA is retained in the managed accounts when Atlassian Access license is expired or unsubscribed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Claim a domain in an organization to have a managed account
# Subscribe for Atlassian Access in the organization
# Enforce two-step verification for the managed account
# Unsubscribe Atlassian Access or wait for the license to expire

h3. Expected Results
Two-step verification is not enforced when Atlassian Access is expired / unsubscribed
h3. Actual Results
Two-step verification is enforced for managed accounts

h3. Workaround
Please reach out to Organization admins to disable "Enforced two-step verification" as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html
fields.summary: Enforced two-step verification is not disabled when Atlassian Access is expired or unsubscribed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There's a current limitation in [SCIM user provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html]:
{quote}Unsupported features

User provisioning doesn't support the following features related to groups:
 * ...
 * _Pushing a group from your identity provider that has the same name as a group in your organization_. Otherwise, you'll get an error when you try to sync.{quote}
This makes the SCIM user provisioning very painful for customers with existing Cloud sites with many users/groups, especially with ACCESS-608 missing. 

With the absence of this feature, admins have to delete all groups from Cloud and let the sync create them again. Furthermore, we can't guarantee permissions will pick up the new groups.
h3. Suggested Solution

Groups should still be synchrnoized even if the exist in Cloud. If a group exists in Cloud, it should just be linked to the group IdM/IdP and reflect any future changes.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: As an admin, I want the SCIM user provisioning to sync groups and memberships from the IdM/IdP even if they exist in my Cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Organization menu, users can verify a domain that has been claimed through G Suite. However, this will break the SSO redirection to Google when logging in, as domain claim is overridden

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect your domain to G Suite, sync G Suite to your cloud instance
# Create an organization
# Claim the domain in the organization

h3. Expected Results
Domain Claim in organization should fail for the domain that has been claimed through G Suite

h3. Actual Results
Domain Claim successful, and override the G Suite domain claim

h3. Notes
In our documentation, we clearly mentioned that it should not be possible:
* [Domain verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/domain-verification-873871234.html]
* {quote}
h3. If you're using G Suite

Your users authenticate with Google. Because you verify your domain as part of your integration with Google, you can't verify your domain from your Atlassian Cloud site. If you want to verify your domain, you'll need to disconnect the G Suite integration.

If your users for another domain aren't connected through G Suite, you can still verify that domain and set a password policy for those users.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
Don't verify the domain again in Organization
fields.summary: In Organization, users can claim a domain that has been claimed by G Suite

fields.description:
When customers access https://admin.atlassian.com, the interface is very confusing for now. 
It's not intuitive that they need to click on their Organization's name in order to manage users, add/remove org admins, etc.
Most of times, customers are used to click on the *manage users* button or even their cloud instance URL expecting that this will take them to their Org.

h3. Suggestion
Create a _Go to your Organization Settings_ button or make the Organization's name looks like a 'button' because, for now, customers are likely to click in wrong places like Manage users or their cloud instance URL
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-20 at 16.32.00.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:title=Issue fixed}
Hi All,

We recently shipped changes to how admins can update password policies and apply the change immediately through the 'reset passwords' option. Please refer to this [support page|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/manage-your-password-policy/] for how the capability works now. 

Thanks,

Narmada Jayasankar

Group Product Manager

Cloud Security @ Atlassian 
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Choosing +Immediately+ apply changes option does not log out users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] and apply the password policies for your managed account and chose to apply it +Immediately+.

h3. Expected Results

The users should have their session revoked and in the next login an attempt should display the following message after the user enter its credentials at [https://id.atlassian.com:|https://id.atlassian.com/]
 !trigger.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The user's session is not revoked.
h3. Workaround
 # Wait for the customers to logout then login again
 # Trigger the *Reset password* at the bottom of that [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] > *Security* > *Password policies*. Currently, there is another bug related to that feature though: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-709.
fields.summary: "Immediately" apply changes option for "Update password policy" is not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After triggering the "Reset Password" for managed accounts at the [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html], users received the following error message when accessing Atlassian products:
Screen Shot 2019-08-15 at 9.14.15 AM.png

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to https://admin.atlassian.com/ as an Org Admin.
# Click on *Security* > *Password management*. 
# Click on *Reset passwords* at the bottom of the page.

h3. Expected Results
After 10 minutes the user loses its session and when trying to log in again it receives a message to reset the password:
!trigger.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
After the user lose the session when it tries to log in again he gets an inactive page: 
!inactive.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Users should reset the password at https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword
fields.summary: Enforced "Password reset" in triggering "Hang on, we need to verify a few things before you can log in" when trying to log back in

fields.description:
Users will sometimes connect Atlassian Access with LDAP for account information. 

In this setup, downstream cloud services will leverage a given user's FirstName and LastName details, but leave out middle initials.

In a sufficiently large organization, it is common to have several people with the same first and last name. Only the middle initial can be used to distinguish them. Is it possible for Access to pull down other name identifying data, like middle initials or middle names?
fields.summary: Allow including middle initial in people's name fields

fields.description:
Currently you have to use the [transfer product|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/transfer-products-to-another-organization-967318518.html]  method in order to move new sites from an auto-created org to your existing org.

This creates a lot of confusion and added work for Org admin, we should ask if they already have an Org or allow site creation under admin.atlassian.com. 

We should also allow org admins to restrict the creation of new cloud sites from www.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Allow admins to manage creation of new sites under the existing org

fields.description:
*Use Case* :

There are situations where a synced account is incorrectly synced with the wrong email from an IDP. A user maybe logging in with an email address in the SSO and will be logged in with a secondary email address in Atlassian. This can happen on email address changes in the IDP that failed to propagate in Atlassian. This can also happen due to a secondary email alias on the IDP while Atlassian Account doesn't support any form of aliasing. 

When an Org Admin encounters this. Help is needed from support. 

- No straightforward indication from org admin of the wrong email address that is synced (ie. External ID connected with the email address propagated to Atlassian: ie. SCIM logs). 
- The Atlassian Account with the wrong email address needs to be unsynced. Perform email address change in Atlassian side if data migration is required.
- The Account needs to be reprovisioned in the IDP side by re-assigning the user to the group.

Unsyncing a user is not a straight forward operation. End users are usually part of a synced groups that poses implications on other systems if the user is removed from it (ie : AD groups that grant access to company resources). When this is the case, Atlassian Access support needs to help with the unsync. 

In Azure, a full resync with clear all status is required if the user cannot be removed and re-added to the synced groups. 

*Suggestion* :

Provide a better way for org admins recover an incorrectly synced user.
fields.summary: Ability to fix incorrectly synced users

fields.description:
Use Case : 

- An organization has their team's accounts maintained on their AD
- They provision the users into Atlassian Cloud or use SAML-SSO. 
- The org members work in cloud and the organization needs to extracts work information for their team via rest api for their own tracking purposes (ie. worklog hours). 
- When end user privacy control kicks in (Visibility=You and Admin), they can only identify their users with Atlassian AccountID (Email ID information is hidden)

When they try to map out the user in their own system, they will not be able to since the Atlassian Account ID information is not available to them. They will need the org admin extract the information manually and maintain this mapping manually in their own system. 


Suggestion :

Option 1 : Provide an org non-admin role that allows to work with email addresses information regardless of the end users profile visibility (private) settings.  

Option 2 : When SAML or User Provisioning is implemented, automatically inform external systems of the org member's Atlassian AccountIDs
fields.summary: Allow non-admin org users to easily identify their org members

fields.description:
If a user logout from an external Identity provider (SAML) their Atlassian session remains, hence for companies where the employees share workstations this can be an issue once another user may access Jira/Confluence as another account.

This suggestion is to provide a way to link the logout system from the IdP with Atlassian.
fields.summary: Logging out from the SAML provider doesn't log out from the Atlassian account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User accounts that have two-step verification enabled do not appear in "Managed accounts" page of the organization

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Enable "Two-step verification" for an account

h3. Expected Results
Account appears in "Managed accounts" page

h3. Actual Results
Account is missing in "Managed accounts" page

h3. Notes
If "two-step verification" is enforced or all managed accounts have two-step verification enabled then "Managed accounts" page appears empty.

h3. Workaround
Add "mfa=true" parameter at the end of URL for "Managed accounts" page to view accounts with enabled two-step verification (2FA or MFA):
* https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<your-organization-id>/members?mfa=true
fields.summary: Accounts with enabled/enforced two-step verification do not appear in "Managed accounts"

fields.description:
Enforced 2FA can be by-passed with "Log in with Google"
h3. Issue Summary

Managed accounts with enforced 2FA that uses Google as the mail service provider can by-pass the 2FA by using the _Log in with Google_ feature.
h3. Environment
 # Your email is managed on Google
 # You have an [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] and an active [Atlassian Access subscription|https://www.google.com/search?q=atlassian+access&oq=atlassian+access&aqs=chrome..69i57j69i60l3j69i65l2.7905j0j4&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8] with a verified domain
 # [Enforce the 2FA for your managed accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html]
 !org.png|thumbnail!
 # Use _Log in with Google_ after the 2FA setting is enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] and instead of entering your email and password which would trigger the 2FA:
 !2fa.png|thumbnail!
 Click at *Log in with Google*.
 # Enter your Google credentials then you will be redirected to [https://start.atlassian.com|https://start.atlassian.com/] with an active session without the need of entering the enforced 2FA code.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be enforced to use the 2FA even when using the _*Log in with Google*_ method.
h3. Actual Results

The _*Log in with Google*_ by-passes the enforced 2FA.
h3. Notes
 - With this procedure, you can also reset the _recovery codes_ if you want to at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage/two-step-verification:]
 !user.png|thumbnail!

 - This is not applicable for [G Suite integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/g-suite-integration-938859740.html] not [SAML|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html] or/and [Provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html].

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Enforced 2FA can be by-passed with "Log in with Google"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
According our latest doc release regarding SAML and Atlassian Account:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html

PingIdentity integration is not yet supported for the end user.
fields.summary: Provide support for SAML integration with PingIdentity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no option to create an additional [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] with the same account. There is an option to access the creation page navigating to the discover applications page (i.e. https://<your-site>.atlassian.net/admin/billing/addapplication)
!image.png|thumbnail!

However, when clicking *Create your Organization* we are redirected to https://admin.atlassian.com/ an the already existent Orgs are displayed.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a method so users that already have Organizations can create new ones.
fields.summary: Allow users to create more than one Organization
Org admins cannot disable 2FA for a provisioned user

fields.description:
At the moment when an AA subscription is disabled (ie. invalid payment method):
 * User provisioning gets wiped out.
 * Authentication policy number is reduced to 1 and SAML SSO enforcement is turned off.

When the subscription is re-enabled, these features need to be reconfigured from scratch.

Suggestions :
 1 - Allow a grace period from the time of disabling the features to actually removing the configurations 
 *OR*
 2 - Revoke the API token so the admins will need to re-subscribe to access to create a new one. If they don't want to continue with Access they should have then an option to delete the directory instead of doing this automatically.
fields.summary: Allow configuration retention for disabled Atlassian Access subscription

fields.description:
As an end user who is managed under an Atlassian organization with a domain claim, I would like a way to find the contact details of my Org Admin.

This may be a direct means of contacting them such as an email address or name, or some form of sending them a message.

This is useful for end users who may not be aware about the impact of their Atlassian account being managed and who are unaware of who their Org Admin is.
fields.summary: Allow site users to view contact information for an Org Admin

fields.description:
The following are currently required for some users who want to do backend reconcialation using the Org Rest APIs : 
 - When a user is invited to the site, they are then part of the billable user count for that site even if they don't log in or accept the invite. In some user's opinion they should not be billable until they log in fore the first time.
 - When an invite goes out there is nothing in the user data to indicate that the user is anything other than active.
 - We need the date/time that the invite went out and whether it was accepted or not.
 - What we need to do is to be able to "expire" those invites which haven't been accepted after a certain number of hours.
fields.summary: Access or Managed Users Need Improved Billing Handling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Several sites have reported receiving an email confirming that they have been made the org admin of their domain when in actuality, no changes were made.

These emails are usually of this format:

{quote}
Hi (*user*),

An admin made you an administrator of the (*domain*) organization.

As an organization admin for (*domain*), you can:

* Administer all the users for your verified domains from one organization.
* Provision users from your identity provider to your organization's products.
* See your organization's products and bills in one place.

View organization

Cheers,
The Atlassians
{quote}

h3. Workaround

There are currently no workarounds. This is currently being investigated internally by Atlassian.
fields.summary: Email being sent out to org admins about changes when none were made

fields.description:
*Problem*
* Managed users can create accounts for every Atlassian Products.

*Suggestion*
* Allow org admins to restrict what products the users can have access.
fields.summary: Restrict what applications managed users can access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

For customers that have Atlassian Access, they pay once per each unique billable user in their organization, regardless of the number of Atlassian Cloud products or sites they have access to. 

Sometimes, users from the organization may create a Bitbucket account with an email from one of the company's verified domains. In case this user does not have already access to any other Atlassian Access supported product (other than Bitbucket), this results to an extra billable user for the organization. The user is often unaware of this consequence.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow admins to restrict the creation of Bitbucket accounts for emails from one of their verified domains.
E.g. For non-admin users, allow the creation of a Bitbucket account only upon invitation.

Another suggestion would be notifying the user that their orgnization pays for this account, and allow the user to delete the Bitbucket account only (without deleting the Atlassian account).
fields.summary: Ability to create a Bitbucket account for non-admins only upon invitation

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The Atlassian Access's landing page only has an option to create a new organization.
 [https://admin.atlassian.com/atlassian-access]
h3. Suggested Solution

Add any suggestion to move on to the next step, such as placing a link saying: "If you've already created an organization, start configurations from [the organization list|https://admin.atlassian.com/]".

Or make the page taking account of the whole configuration process per user.
h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email. Until then,
 * Use the link of Atlassian icon so that you can browse a full list of existing organizations; however, as it is more like a UX issue, introducing workaround seems ineffectual.
 ** !Screenshot 2019-06-12 09.01.49.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a clear guide for the users who already created any organizations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When successfully logging in a Cloud site with a Managed Account, the Last Seen information is updated in the Site Administration, while the Last Active in the Organization does not.

h3. Additional comments

* Performed an attempt using [Can't Login|https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword];
* Performed an attempt authenticating using the credentials.

h3. Environment

* Had SAML SSO set up with Azure and was able to reproduce the behavior;
* Removed the SAML integration and was able to reproduce the behavior.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an organization and verify your domain;
# Add your site;
# Login using the site URL or http://id.atlassian.com

h3. Expected Results

Both Last Seen and Last Active would be updated.

h3. Actual Results

Only the Last Seen is updated.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Last Active (Organization) and Last Seen (Site Administration) information not syncing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for an account using a full name, the results maybe incorrect sometimes. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup 2 users in Manage Accounts

||Name||Email Address||
|Rian Liaser|rian.liaser@xxxxxxx|
|Giana Maserati|gmaserati@xxxxxx||

 2.  Search for "Giana Maserati" in Managed Accounts

h3. Expected Results

gmaserati@xxxxxx should be returned at the top of the results. 

h3. Actual Results

rian.liaser@xxxxxxx is returned to the top and gmaserati@xxxxxx second. 

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Managed account search may sometimes miss a full name search

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Privacy* level of managed Atlassian account can only be set by the user to either *Public*, *Collaborators* or *Private* through [their Profile|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/privacy].

 !Atlassian_account.png|thumbnail! 

As an Organisation admin, I'm unable to set myself for a managed account. The only editable data are the *Name*, *Email address* and *Job title.

 !Administration.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

A *Privacy level* field should be added so that this can be managed on an Admin level for an organisation.
fields.summary: Need option to set Privacy setting as an Organisation admin

fields.description:
In bigger organizations, teams work independently from each other. There can be situations that 2 independent teams are allowed to update the DNS record for the same domain. In such situation, one organization may unintentionally take over the domain ownership from another team's organization. 

Suggestion :

When claiming a domain, check if the domain is owned by another organization in Atlassian Access. If the organization has existing security configurations, an approval from the org admin needs to be accomplished before the new organization can take over.
fields.summary: Stronger controls on domain verification

fields.description:
{panel:title=Release Update}
Hi,

 We are excited to announce that we have shipped the Authentication policies feature. You can now apply 2FA on a subset of managed accounts using this feature ([https://www.atlassian.com/software/access/guide/elements/authentication-policies#why-apply-multiple-authentication-policies]). We are still in the last leg of the rollout. If your organization doesn’t have the feature yet, file a support ticket ([https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/]) and we will enable the feature for you.

 

Thanks,

The Atlassian Access team.
{panel}
 

At the moment, enforcing 2FA is only allowed on domain level. In relation ACCESS-572, bigger organization with different independent teams can benefit on selectively enforcing 2FA to a sub-group of domain users, possibly site-specific.
fields.summary: Allow enforcing 2FA on a sub-set of domain users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 June 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone!

The managed account search is a “fuzzy” search that returns both the closest exact match for the search query and users whose email or username is an approximate match for the query. This is a feature and not a bug. We’ve designed the search this way to allow for flexibility and allow admins to find what they’re looking for when they aren’t sure of the exact search string. Here is an example of how searching might work:

1. An admin searches for ‘robertsmith’
 2. A user who’s email is robertsmith@atlassian.com will show on top of the search results, since this is the longest closest match
 3. A user who’s email is alicesmith@atlassian.com will show further in the search results, because this user has ‘smith’ in common with the original ‘robertsmith’

We hope this clarifies search behavior on the managed accounts page. Please feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions!

Cheers, 
 Rak Garg
 Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The search in managed accounts fails when the complete email of the user is provided in the search textbox.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the "Managed Accounts" of an organisation.
 # Search users using the complete email id(including the domain).

h3. Expected Results

The user with the exact email address shows up at top of the search.
h3. Actual Results

Random users are shown as the search tries to find users based on the domain as well, which matches a lot of other users.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search fails when searching for a user with the complete email

fields.description:
When an Org admin attempts to change the email address of one of his managed accounts to an Unverified domain or to a Managed domain of another Organization he doesn't receive an error message if the target email is already related to an Atlassian account. What happens is that the target email receives the following message at the mailbox.

!Screen Shot 2019-05-09 at 15.42.21.png|thumbnail!

The Org admin will only be aware that the change wasn't possible if his user informs him. It would be great if the administration UI informed that the change can't be made because this can cause confusion and mislead administrators when trying to change the emails of their users.
fields.summary: Changing the email address to an Unverified domain or to a domain of another Org doesn't return error if the target email is already taken

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, adding a site to an Organization allows all org-admins to be site-admins.

It will be great to be possible to exclude certain org-admins from being site-admins, or to have another permission level inside the org to allow restricting some users product administration rights.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-07 at 18.32.13.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide ability to limit which Org admins become site admins when linking site to org

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As per the user-provisioning [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html#Userprovisioning-Supporteduseraccountoperations] the feature currently supports the sync of:
 * Display name
 * Email address
 * Organization
 * Job title
 * Timezone
 * Department
 * Preferred language

But it's not possible to sync additional attributes (e.g. *Based in*, *Employee ID*).
h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for additional attributes from the identity provider that may be added in the future.
fields.summary: Support more attributes for user-provisioning
